Selected Answer: A

comments.content: Sorry this wouldn't allow me to correct this. Please disregard the answer is A

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The answer would be "B" based on the higher priority being "ServiceNow." Once the source from the higher priority updates the field it checks the "cmdb_datasource_last_update" table. If the fields been updated the lower priority source is skipped. 

Resource: https://support.servicenow.com/kb?id=kb_article_view&sysparm_article=KB0756709 (Updated Jan 18 2024)

Correct answer: A. The name of the CI stays ‘Windows1’.
Reasoning: If multiple data sources are authorized to update the same table in the CMDB based on reconciliation definition, then a lower order data source has higher priority than a higher order data source.
The answer is A due to the order on the Data Source Precedents.
The answer is A because have de order 100

Selected Answer: B
the rules run in the order from lowest to highest.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Based on the following images, which choice best describes what occurs if Discovery sets the name attribute of a discovered Windows Server CI to 'Windows1' and then Altiris discovery runs detecting 'Windows2' for the name attribute on the same CI?

choices.C: The name of the CI does not populate with either discovery.
choices.D: The CI is not discovered because Discovery is not listed in either image.
choices.B: The name of the CI changes to 'Windows2'.
choices.A: The name of the CI stays 'Windows1'.
